bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 26, 1950

div1.p: Lawrence Reed thanks Kean for his expression of sympathy upon Emilie Lawrence Reed's death.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Jefferson Randolph Kean, July 26, 1950
div1.opener:
Do not return this-
MAJOR GENERAL WALTER L. REED
2810 THIRTY SIX PLACE
WASHINGTON, D. C.
July 26th 1950
Dear General Kean-
div1.p:
Blossom and I deeply
appreciate your sincere expressions of
sympathy and your beautiful thoughts
often passing-

We were most grateful that so
many distinguished officers of the Medical
Corps were present at the service, it
was indeed a beautiful tribute to my
Father-

Blossom and I both thought of you
and again wish to thank you and Mrs
Kean for your kind thoughts and sympathy
Hope to see you very soon-
